column5: Thank you.  I can't take any credit for the beautiful wood seats, they're done by my buddy John @ jccustomtackle      I've been working on my own seats with some help from John, though I've been unable to progress much due to a broken wrist and a couple of fingers.....  But I did these with some practice wood, still in the rough stages though.       Here's a few pictures of one I sent to BC last week for member "Bare foot wader" who wanted a removable/add weighted butt cap system.
Really nice work Chris!! I will swing by later in the winter for some guide repairs on my walleye rods.
Those handles would make a great pipe. Just say,n.
And even better duck calls, eh?
LOL Ya them too.
Quack....    Quack.
You know where to find me Pete.
Chris does nice work...and to pair that with awesome customer service...can't beat that. Here's one of his handy work...

I don't know Chris. Looks like you have the technique down perfectly. Theres something about a fine piece of hardwood. Each piece has its own personality. Your work brings the personality out of that piece of wood. Very nicely done.
Just a few pictures of what I've been working on the last few weeks. All rods are now ready for delivery.
Awesome work as always Chris !!
Absolutely beautiful work.
Can't wait to see my new one in the spring! wooooooooooohoooooooooooo! You do fantastic work my friend.
I will place an order one day.
sexsay!...very nice...i would be scared to use it ...
Beautiful work Spiel!
Nice work as usual but none of them are the one I ordered.....Springs coming....just sayin.   Art
Beautiful rods.  Awesome work.
I knew this address on my cork board was for something.  Very nice work Chris.
Nice clean work! Ches

Having seen all these rods... and looking at and critiquing each one (Hey Gerritt, Look at this one... what do you think? during each step of the process..) I have to say they are all going to make some fishermen pretty happy... I think I will take the GLX....    :Gonefishing:  :asshat:  :unsure:  :rolleyes:  :clapping:  :whistling:  :thumbsup_anim:  G.
Awesome craftsmanship Chris
Just beautiful work Chris.  I'm impressed
One of those wouldn't be mine bye chance would it?

Hey Chris, the quality of the cork on what I'm assuming is the GLX handle (those are Ferg's spec's  ) is exponentially better.  That's the quality of cork I want on my handle.  Now please perform a miracle and find me some LOL!

Fantastic work once again Chris, you build rods with the passion, and attention to detail, like you were building them for yourself, for anyone looking for a great builder Speils your man, the CTS I have, that you originally built for Solo, is a real pleasure to fish, and comforting knowing that your hands put it together.
That GLX prototype is slick, Ferg is going to LOVE that rod!!!   I'll make sure to steal it from him for a few drifts  I'm looking forward to Mike's review of the new 2pc 13' CTS.

Thanks everyone. I really enjoy doing the handle work, it's the guide winding and finishing that I abhor but you can't fish 'em without guides.    Ya ya!    Sorry Fusion, still waiting for my big cork order.    As noted above Mike, still waiting, hopefully it's a good or better. If I recall Ferg supplied that cork and it was exceptional!    It is nice Bill and Ferg keeps reminding me it's one of only 10 out there.
Ya know.   If I would ever switch over to the baitcasting reels .. I'd need to have a couple of those.   Great work Chris.
Spiel has made me some really nice spinning rods too, Rich. Just sayin'.

Nice work, can't wait to see the minnows scales on those handles Bet you can't catch Sheep-head on those rods. Did you say you wanted me to autograph them Chris Good work as usual Chris Just the Farmer pulling your chain.
The ones I've seen, they all show great craftmanship.

Thanks Rich  The ones pictured are all Steelhead/Floatrods. The top one is a 15' CTS Second one a 13" Loomis GLX strip and rebuild Followed by 2 more CTS' at 13.5'  Seems to be a big demand for steelhead rods.
For what its worth Chris, those are some of the finest looking rods i have seen. It must require a steady, confident hand to achieve the workmanship displayed in those rods.
